FuncDef:
The pd-unshare-only command configures a delegation prefix pool for only DHCPv6 IA_PD prefix allocation.
The undo pd-unshare-only command cancels the configuration.
By default, a delegation prefix pool is used for DHCPv6 IA_PD prefix allocation and stateless address autoconfiguration in unshared mode.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the delegation prefix pools for ND prefix allocation need to be differentiated with the delegation prefix pools for DHCPv6 IA_PD prefix allocation on a device, run the slaac-unshare-only command and the pd-unshare-only command in the corresponding delegation prefix pools.
Configuration Impact
After the pd-unshare-only command is run for a delegation prefix pool, this prefix pool can be used only for DHCPv6 IA_PD prefix allocation and is preferred in DHCPv6 IA_PD prefix allocation.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Multiple address pools can be configured in a domain, and the address pool with the highest priority is preferred. A remote prefix pool configured only for DHCPv6 prefix or address allocation has a priority over that without the preceding configuration.
